name: violently
content:

B2 in a forceful way that causes people to be hurt: He claimed to have been violently assaulted while in detention.
strongly or extremely: She violently disagreed with what we said. He was violently sick (= he vomited a lot).
More examplesFewer examplesPolice and rioters clashed violently.She shook the bottle violently and showered us with champagne.The car hit a patch of ice and slewed around violently.They were violently opposed to change.They attacked the boys violently with pieces of wood.
